title: EPISTOLA William R. Harmon
html:
EPISTOLA William R. Harmon

Enjoyed Pat Sheil's article, “I before E.” But I guess they teach English a bit differently down under. In an early grade in the early '30s in deepest, darkest Wichita, Kansas, I was taught: “ i before e, except after c, or when sounded like a, as in neighbor or weigh .” Obviously the word eight should be added to that short list.

[William R. Harmon]
